title: Indonesia Election Archive
text:
The data available here is described in further detail in the accompanying paper, which should be cited as:
Khoirunnisa Agustyati, Heroik Pratama, Jóhanna K. Birnir, Henry Overos, Fadli Ramadhanil, and Amalinda Savirani. 2024. Indonesian election archive: Institutions, candidates and results. Working paper.
ALL LINKS WILL BE LIVE AT PUBLICATION.
The paper is available here:
PAPER LINK HERE
The code used to generate the descriptives and the spatial illustrations of the data are all available here:
REPLICATION CODE HERE
Finally, the codebook pertaining to the pre-election candidate data and post-election results is available here:
Codebook.V1
© 2024 Jóhanna K Birnir.

title: Institutions
text:
The below tables is represented by Figure 4 in Agustyati et.al. (nd) and includes information on the law regulating elections by office and whether the law is current or regulated earlier elections. Additionally, the last row contains laws on political parties as these regulate candidate nominations and organization of parties competing in elections. Each law can be accessed by clicking on the pertinent link. (Unofficial English translations (U.E) are linked alongside the law where available).
ALL LINKS WILL BE LIVE AT PUBLICATION.

title: Pre-election candidate information
text:
The below table is represented by Figure 6 in Agustyati et.al. (nd) and includes national level information on candidates competing for the office of the President and Vice President, district level information for the lower chamber of the legislature (DPR), and provincial level information for the upper level of the legislature (DPD). Information for each office at each level and election are provided in a separate sheet in a .csv format and can be accessed by clicking on the pertinent hyper-link. The information for a given level includes standardized identifiers including election year, name of office, provincial level identifiers and where relevant district level identifiers as articulated in version 1 (V1) of the Codebook.V1. For longitudinal analysis of multiple elections the information from discrete sheets can, therefore, be easily combined.
ALL LINKS WILL BE LIVE AT PUBLICATION.

title: Post-election results
text:
The below tables is represented by Figure 7 in Agustyati et.al. (nd) and includes information on provincial level votes cast for candidates competing for the office of the President and Vice President, district level votes for parties fielding candidates competing for seats to the lower chamber of the legislature (DPR), and provincial level votes for the upper level of the legislature (DPD). Results for each office at each level and election are provided in a separate sheet in a .csv format and can be accessed by clicking on the pertinent hyper-link. The information for a given level includes standardized identifiers including election year, name of office, provincial level identifiers and where relevant district level identifiers as articulated in version 1 (V1) of the Codebook.V1. For longitudinal analysis of multiple elections the information from discrete sheets can, therefore, be easily combined.
ALL LINKS WILL BE LIVE AT PUBLICATION.
